sentences.text: The '''2023 G20 New Delhi summit''' was the List of G20 summits|eighteenth meeting of the G20 (Group of Twenty), a Head of State and Government meeting held at Bharat Mandapam| Bharat Mandapam, Pragati Maidan, Delhi on 9–10 September 2023. It was the first G20 summit held in India.{{refn|}}

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |last=Livemint |date=2023-09-07 |title=G20 Summit 2023 Delhi LIVE update: PM Modi finalises agreements with Joe Biden |url=https://www.livemint.com/news/india/g20-summit-2023-delhi-live-updates-dates-countries-to-participating-leaders-all-that-you-should-you-know-11694049208072.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230908114813/https://www.livemint.com/news/india/g20-summit-2023-delhi-live-updates-dates-countries-to-participating-leaders-all-that-you-should-you-know-11694049208072.html |archive-date=8 September 2023 |access-date=2023-09-08 |website=mint |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news |date=2023-09-10 |title=As Delhi G20 Summit ends, PM Modi hands over group presidency to Brazil |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/india/g20-summit-ends-pm-modi-presidency-brazil-8933223/ |access-date=2023-09-10 |website=The Indian Express |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text:
Originally, India was scheduled to host the List of G20 summits|G20 summit in 2021 and Italy in 2022. At the 2018 G20 Buenos Aires summit in Argentina, Prime Minister of India|Prime Minister Narendra Modi said he had requested Italy to host the summit in 2021 and allow India to host it in 2022, on the occasion of the 75th year of Indian independence movement|India's independence. 
Italy agreed to let India host the G20 summit in 2022 in its place, owing to the momentum in bilateral ties.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news|url=https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/warmth-in-ties-prompts-italy-to-let-india-host-g20-summit-in-2022/articleshow/66913607.cms?from=mdr|title=Warmth in ties prompts Italy to let India host G20 Summit in 2022|first=Dipanjan Roy|last=Chaudhury|newspaper=The Economic Times|date=3 December 2018|access-date=25 August 2023|archive-date=25 August 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230825234845/https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/warmth-in-ties-prompts-italy-to-let-india-host-g20-summit-in-2022/articleshow/66913607.cms?from=mdr|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: However, after a request made by Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Indonesia)|Indonesian Foreign Minister Retno Marsudi, India exchanged its presidency of the G20 with Indonesia because Indonesia would also chair the ASEAN|Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) in 2023.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.straitstimes.com/asia/se-asia/indonesia-india-swap-g-20-upcoming-presidency-term|title=Indonesia, India swap G-20 upcoming presidency term|date=23 November 2020|newspaper=The Straits Times|access-date=25 August 2023|archive-date=25 August 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230825234845/https://www.straitstimes.com/asia/se-asia/indonesia-india-swap-g-20-upcoming-presidency-term|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: The G20 New Delhi Summit was chaired by the Indian Prime Minister, Narendra Modi. India's presidency began on 1 December 2022, leading up to the summit in the third quarter of 2023. The presidency handover ceremony was held, in which the G20 presidency gavel was transferred from President of Indonesia|Indonesian President Joko Widodo to Indian Prime Minister Modi at the close of the 2022 G20 Bali summit|Bali summit. Indonesia held the presidency in 2022.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |last=Anuj |date=2022-12-12 |title=India's G20 Presidency and {{as written|I|t's [sic]}} Implications |url=https://pashubazzar.in/2022/12/12/indias-g20-presidency-and-its-implications/ |access-date=2022-12-17 |website=Perfect Review |language=en-US |archive-date=12 December 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221212065539/https://pashubazzar.in/2022/12/12/indias-g20-presidency-and-its-implications/ |url-status=dead }}</ref>
references.reason: Cannot connect to host pashubazzar.in:443 ssl:default [Domain name not found]

sentences.text: Indian Prime Minister Modi formally handed over the G20 presidency to Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, the President of Brazil. India would continue to hold the position until 30 November 2023.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |date=2023-09-10 |title=India hands over G20 presidency to Brazil |language=en |publisher=Reuters |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/india-hands-over-g20-presidency-brazil-2023-09-10/ |access-date=2023-09-10}}</ref>

sentences.text: G20 India has put forth six agenda priorities for the G20 dialogue in 2023:

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |date= |title=Overview of G20 |url=https://moes.gov.in/g20-india-2023/moes-g20?language_content_entity=en |publisher=Ministry of Earth Sciences, India |access-date=16 June 2023 |archive-date=16 June 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230616061331/https://moes.gov.in/g20-india-2023/moes-g20?language_content_entity=en |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: In an interview on 26 August 2023, Prime Minister Modi expressed optimism about the G20 countries' evolving agenda under India's presidency, shifting toward a human-centric development approach that aligns with the concerns of the Global South, including addressing climate change, debt restructuring  through the G20's Common Framework for Debt, and a strategy for regulation of global cryptocurrencies.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-08-26 |title=PM Narendra Modi interview highlights: From G20 presidency to India as a manufacturing destination, PM lays out his expansive vision for the country |url=https://www.businesstoday.in/latest/in-focus/story/pm-narendra-modi-interview-highlights-from-g20-presidency-to-india-as-a-manufacturing-destination-pm-lays-out-his-expansive-vision-for-the-country-395743-2023-08-26 |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Business Today |language=en |archive-date=28 August 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230828052845/https://www.businesstoday.in/latest/in-focus/story/pm-narendra-modi-interview-highlights-from-g20-presidency-to-india-as-a-manufacturing-destination-pm-lays-out-his-expansive-vision-for-the-country-395743-2023-08-26 |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news |title=Exclusive {{!}} PM Modi calls for global framework on cryptocurrency. Here's what he said |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/business/story/exclusive-pm-modi-global-framework-cryptocurrency-here-what-he-said-2426908-2023-08-26 |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=India Today |date=26 August 2023 |language=en |archive-date=28 August 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230828062356/https://www.indiatoday.in/business/story/exclusive-pm-modi-global-framework-cryptocurrency-here-what-he-said-2426908-2023-08-26 |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-08-26 |title='G20 की अध्यक्षता कर पूरी दुनिया को नई राह दिखा रहा भारत', Exclusive इंटरव्यू में बोले पीएम मोदी |url=https://www.aajtak.in/india/news/story/exclusive-interview-of-pm-narendra-modi-chairmanship-of-g-20-talks-on-russia-ukraine-war-and-china-ntc-1765996-2023-08-26 |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=आज तक |language=hi |archive-date=28 August 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230828062357/https://www.aajtak.in/india/news/story/exclusive-interview-of-pm-narendra-modi-chairmanship-of-g-20-talks-on-russia-ukraine-war-and-china-ntc-1765996-2023-08-26 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: The Government of India budgeted Rs. 990 crore (US$120 million) for the G20 events.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news|date=2023-02-01|title=In Budget, ₹990 crore for G20 presidency, ₹100 cr for Iran's Chabahar port |url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/in-budget-rs-990-crore-for-g20-presidency-rs-100-cr-for-iran-s-chabahar-port-101675254726520.html|access-date=2023-09-09|website=Hindustan Times|language=en|archive-date=27 March 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230327021233/https://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/in-budget-rs-990-crore-for-g20-presidency-rs-100-cr-for-iran-s-chabahar-port-101675254726520.html |url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: In the lead up to the G20 meeting, the Indian authorities, including the Archaeological Survey of India embarked on a mass demolition drive against homeless shelters and slum neighborhoods across New Delhi resulting in the eviction of its marginalized residents.  Structures near the summit site were removed for being illegal, after giving residents time to vacate. Other demolitions occurred in areas far from the G20 venue, also following court orders. According to the 'Concerned Citizens' collective, this resulted in the Community displacement|displacement of an estimated 0.25 to 0.3 million people.

references.text: <ref name="cnn-2023-09-04">{{cite news|title=India, advocate for the global poor, clears slums as G20 draw near|url=https://www.cnn.com/2023/09/04/india/g20-summit-india-slum-home-demolitions-intl-hnk-dst/index.html|publisher=CNN|date=5 September 2023|language=en|access-date=5 September 2023|archive-date=5 September 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230905191512/https://www.cnn.com/2023/09/04/india/g20-summit-india-slum-home-demolitions-intl-hnk-dst/index.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news|last1=Mehrotra|first1=Karishma|last2=Shih|first2=Gerry|title=As G-20 meetings come to India, Modi launches a public relations blitz|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/03/21/g20-india-modi-public-relations/|newspaper=Washington Post|date=20 March 2023|quote=In recent weeks, the Indian government has also bulldozed homeless shelters and slums in New Delhi, which activists say are part of a G-20 beautification campaign that is dislocating the poor|access-date=5 September 2023|archive-date=22 March 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230322172652/https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/03/21/g20-india-modi-public-relations/|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news|title=Many New Delhi slums disappear ahead of G20 summit|url=https://news.yahoo.com/many-delhi-slums-disappear-ahead-124043677.html|work=Yahoo News|agency=Reuters|date=5 September 2023|access-date=5 September 2023|archive-date=5 September 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230905191513/https://news.yahoo.com/many-delhi-slums-disappear-ahead-124043677.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |title=In India, Modi makes New Delhi's poverty temporarily disappear for the G20 summit |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/en/international/article/2023/09/07/in-india-modi-makes-new-delhi-s-poverty-temporarily-disappear-for-the-g20-summit_6128001_4.html |work=Le Monde |date=7 September 2023 |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news |date=1 June 2023 |title=PWD demolishes illegal slums near Pragati Maidan |url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/cities/delhi-news/pwd-demolishes-illegal-slums-near-pragati-maidan-101685643834416.html |work=The Hindustan Times}}</ref>

<ref name="Frontline"/> In Delhi alone, almost 25 slums were bulldozed to the ground, including settlements in Yamuna Bank metro station|Yamuna Bank, Tughlaqabad and Mehrauli, among others.<ref name="Frontline">{{cite news|title=How G20 preparations left thousands homeless in India|url=https://frontline.thehindu.com/news/commissioned-citizens-report-g20-preparations-leave-thousands-homeless-in-india/article67131721.ece|work=Frontline|date=28 July 2023|language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |title=India Removes the Poor to Prepare for G20 Gathering |url=https://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/india-removes-the-poor-to-prepare-for-g20-gathering/7256848.html |publisher=VOA |date=6 September 2023 |language=en |quote=In July, a report by a rights activist group found that preparations for the G20 summit resulted in the displacement of nearly 300,000 people.}}</ref>

sentences.text: In the days prior to the summit, the New Delhi Municipal Council|New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) placed life-size Standee|cutouts of langurs in several parts of the city to scare away the smaller rhesus macaque monkeys. The Municipal Corporation of Delhi rounded up almost 1,000 Street dogs|stray dogs and moved them to Animal shelter|shelters in the run-up to the G20 summit.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |last1=Yasir |first1=Sameer |last2=Ives |first2=Mike |title=India's Preparations for G20 Must Also Account for Monkeys |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2023/09/07/world/asia/g20-summit-monkeys-india-delhi.html |work=The New York Times |date=7 September 2023}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |last1=Dayal |first1=Sakshi |title=Monkey business: Delhi gets cutouts of langurs to ease menace during G20 |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/india/monkey-business-delhi-gets-cutouts-langurs-ease-menace-during-g20-2023-08-31/ |publisher=Reuters |date=31 August 2023 |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |last1=Fadnavis |first1=Anushree |last2=Dayal |first2=Sakshi |title=After slums and monkeys, Delhi removes stray dogs from streets as G20 nears |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/china/after-slums-monkeys-delhi-removes-stray-dogs-streets-g20-nears-2023-09-07/ |publisher=Reuters |date=8 September 2023 |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |title=New Delhi got a makeover for the G20 summit. The city's poor say they were simply erased |url=https://apnews.com/article/india-g20-new-delhi-poor-9d449f133d5ed0aa8855ee65485ce873 |publisher=Associated Press |date=4 September 2023 |language=en |quote=Many of the city's poor say they were simply erased, much like the stray dogs and monkeys that have been removed from some neighborhoods, as India's capital got its makeover ahead of this week's summit of the Group of 20 nations.}}</ref>

sentences.text: For the security of the event, the government had deployed 130,000 security personnel, including 80,000 police officers from Delhi Police.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news|last=Livemint|date=2023-09-03|title=G20 Summit: Anti-drone systems, 130,000 security officers to guard Delhi|url=https://www.livemint.com/news/india/g20-summit-anti-drone-systems-130-000-security-officers-to-guard-delhi-11693749579921.html|access-date=2023-09-09|website=mint|language=en|archive-date=5 September 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230905043927/https://www.livemint.com/news/india/g20-summit-anti-drone-systems-130-000-security-officers-to-guard-delhi-11693749579921.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: In the shutdown imposed on the 32 million people living in Delhi, all schools, offices, workplaces, marketplaces, restaurants and non-food shops were ordered to close for three days. Movement on the roads was also restricted, all Food delivery|food deliveries were restricted in areas under New Delhi Municipal Council|NDMC and people were recommended to Stay-at-home order|stay at home.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |last1=Hassan |first1=Aakash |last2=Ellis-Petersen |first2=Hannah |title='Ashamed of our presence': Delhi glosses over plight of poor as it rolls out G20 red carpet |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/08/ashamed-of-our-presence-delhi-glosses-over-plight-of-poor-as-it-rolls-out-g20-red-carpet |work=The Guardian |date=8 September 2023}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.business-standard.com/india-news/g20-summit-here-is-a-look-at-traffic-advisory-by-the-delhi-traffic-police-123090800806_1.html|title=G20 Summit: Here is a look at traffic advisory by the Delhi Traffic Police}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news |date=2023-09-07 |title=G20: From Banks To Food Delivery, Here's All You Need To Know About Restrictions In Delhi/NCR |url=https://business.outlookindia.com/news/g20-from-banks-to-food-delivery-heres-all-you-need-to-know-about-restrictions-in-delhincr |access-date=2023-09-10 |website=Outlook Business |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: The Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping decided to skip the summit in the Indian capital. Their places were taken up by Russian foreign minister Sergey Lavrov and Chinese premier Li Qiang, respectively.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |title=Biden Heads to G20 Summit; Putin, Xi Not Expected to Attend |url=https://www.voanews.com/a/biden-heads-to-g20-summit-putin-xi-not-expected-to-attend-/7256229.html |publisher=VOA |date=6 September 2023 |language=en |access-date=6 September 2023 |archive-date=6 September 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230906180940/https://www.voanews.com/a/biden-heads-to-g20-summit-putin-xi-not-expected-to-attend-/7256229.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text:
* The African Union joined the G20 as a permanent member, the first since the G20's formation in 1999.
* A new organization called the Global Biofuel Alliance (GBA) was launched, to promote the development and adoption of sustainable biofuels, and set relevant standards and certification.
* The New Delhi Leaders Declaration was adopted with consensus.
* A group of countries made a joint agreement to build a rail and shipping corridor linking India with the Middle East and Europe called the India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor. The group comprises India, Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, Jordan, Israel and the European Union.
